Articles.Content:
I made this rocket a few days to see if I could get a rocket with a totally asymmetric boost system into orbit. It\'s certainly not efficient because of weight balancing, but if you stage it correctly it will get its capsule into orbit with enough fuel for a return.

If you want to fly it yourself study the stage separation I use in the video above, since it\'s very important to jettison the early stages at the correct time, or the launch with fail.

Very impressive that you made one that was flyable without ASAS. An ASAS coupled with SAS helps tremendously (try popping one on top of the SAS unit on your rocket and see the difference). Without the ASAS-SAS combo, my Deimos II is impossible to fly manually.
